Reviews.Content: The position was great The staff were great--helpful with every query. The position is fantastic-just a step away from the beautiful Coogee beach. We had a garden room which meant an outside area with a wall and a few plants but only a view of a wall!! This did not matter. The room was small but comfortable and had everything we needed. The bathroom was tired but clean .We would definitely stay there again.
Reviews.Author: Gemstone511

Reviews.Content: Coogee Sands nice but not overly I stayed in this place which has a lovely location right at the end of Coogee Beach, and also has a roof terrace from which you can admire the view over the beach and Coogee, or even have a takeaway meal up there and admire the sunset. Everything was great except for the fact that the studios are tiny, one on top of the other down a long corridor, and some have interconnecting doors so that you can hear every word from next door. I was awoken early the first morning by the alarm of the person next door and had to listen to all his morning routine. It was more like sharing a room. They're a little overpriced for what you're getting - the courtyard studios do have little private courtyards, but they're really tiny and mostly with taller buildings overlooking them so not even private. I would presume the ocean view studios were nicer but I didn't see these as they were full.I'd say the best things going for this place are its location and the roof terrace, and that if you book, make sure to get an ocean view studio or apartment and not any of the others.
Reviews.Author: GBtravelIt

Reviews.Content: Fantastic location This property says it's right on the beach at Coogee, and it is. There is a footpath and grassy park between your balcony and the sand. Ask for a balcony room with the beach view - sit out with a drink and watch the passing parade and the pacific. Our room was very nice, and had a handy little kitchenette with sink and microwave, crockery etc. Very clean and tasteful, your average sort of hotel room. My husband found the bed too soft, and there was quite a bit of noise from the pub next door, even late on a Sunday night. Quieter though on the Monday night. Parking is undercover and secure, and easy to find right at the end of Dolphin Street. Bus into the city takes about half an hour, and the stop is a 2 minute walk. No shopping to speak of in Coogee itself, but lots of great eating choices, and a good fish and chip shop right in the middle of the park on the beach. You can walk to Bondi Beach along the beaches and cliffs in about 2 hours, on a very good path. Coogee has 3 separate sea-pools/baths, and one is for ladies only.  I loved this property, and would like to stay for a week with my teenagers, as Coogee has a real beachy-casual thongs and bathers feel, while the city is only a bus away.
Reviews.Author: reggiekelpie

Reviews.Content: Family Feel Property! This property has a great atmosphere, warm staff and friendly service, not only is the location perfect for walking by the coast, relaxing on the beach, dinning in one of the numerous cafes coogee has to offer, the area has a village feel and the staff are so welcoming i didnt want to go home! I travel for business regularly and when you get the chance to unwind, a location and property like this one is perfect, highly reccomend!
Reviews.Author: ClaireTaylor

Reviews.Content: Absolutely Fantastic!!! Me and my partner stayed for 2 weeks and had a brilliant stay. Our room was really well equiped with the kitchenette and utensils, and the bed was so comfy! Haven't had a better sleep! The location is amazing, just 20 metres away from the beach and everything like bus stops and shops are in 5minutes walking distance! The staff were impeccable, reception is open 24 hours and the staff were so helpful and a delight to talk to. I would highly recommend this hotel to others and have done to many friends which have also enjoyed their stay!
Reviews.Author: Marguerite-Brighton

Reviews.Content: Coogee Sands Hotel is a living nightmare - AVOID RIPOFF This business has two types of accommodation. One is for the Apartments which are at the back of the property - away from the Hotel. No views from what I could see, just an apartment block built in an old carpark by the looks of thingsWe booked to stay in the Hotel, what a nightmare. The room was so old and rundown you could almost see the germs. The shower had missing tiles and the toilet was older than me. The double bed sank so low in the middle I had to use the single bed. The worst part was the fact the rooms are just above the actual Hotel where bands play until about 3.00 in the morning. There is no insulation at all so the sound is beyond imagination, TOTALLY impossible to sleep. Believe me, these bands are crap too so it is not like you are sitting awake in your room enjoying the music.When the bands finally finished the patrons came out onto the street, just under our window. They fought, argued, vomited etc etc and generally hung around until about 5.00 am.I am shocked this place has a license to accommodate people in the Hotel as it is impossible to sleep. Other guests were wandering the halls trying to calm down while the patronswere screaming and chanting to the music just below. I had gone to Sydney to attend a course and had to miss the Sunday as I had gone the whole night without sleep and had to drive back to Melbourne the next day. This Hotel ruined my weekend. I complained to them but they don't care as there is another 'mug' booking in to take my place every night.I STRONGLY recommend you avoid this place, it's a total ripoff and they don't care.
Reviews.Author: blueblaze

Reviews.Content: I'd pass on the Coogee.... I wouldn't stay here. True, the location is amazing, right on Coogee Beach and the place did include a full but tiny kitchen. However, the shower was tiny and there were tiny little bugs crawling out of the drain. Granted, I didn't call them to complain until checking out, but you'd think that the cleaning staff would see the bugs when cleaning up the place. The elevator didn't always work (the front staff had to unlock it remotely and didn't always clue in....) and the door to the parking garage was open, loading the front lobby with lovely fumes.
Reviews.Author: Canuk17

Reviews.Content: Fantastic position We had never visited Coogee before and we were so lucky that we chose Coogee Sands to stay for the first time. The view from our room had partial ocean views but that was ok because the roof top was amazing for sitting in the sun reading a book, having a bbq or just watching the waves. The position of Coogee Sands is awesome. There are plenty of shops and restaurants close by. Our room was well equiped and clean and the staff at the front desk were extremely helpful. We had to extend our stay by a night and they obliged and even gave us the same discount rate that we had been paying. The Saturday night we were there, there was a group of guys staying on our floor and a couple of times they (in a drunken state) mistook our room for their mates and woke us up. The staff at the front desk were most apologetic and were dealing with the situation. A great place to stay. We will be back!
Reviews.Author: bmam

Reviews.Content: Perfect for coogee stay I stayed here for two 5 day blocks during my stay in Oz and it was ideal for me. Good location at the end of the beach, you get nice big room with small kitchen area that has a microwave and fridge, no oven, Front desk are friendly and there 24/7. No other facilities like pool or bar but you don't need them - you're in Sydney! Unless you're really going to spend a lot of time in your room, I wouldn't bother paying for a sea view. The Palis nightclub is next door - be aware that if your in a room backing onto that, you may here some tunes during backpacker season. For meals head up Coogee Bay Road and try one of the many nice resturants up there. Make sure you do the Coogee to Bondi walk (1.5 hours) and Coogee to Maroubra Beack walk (50 mins). regular buses to cicular key via Randwick and Central station, and also Bondi Junction. Free parking too.
Reviews.Author: Briggs2806

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel and Awesome Location       The Roof
Reviews.Author: AZShelly

Reviews.Content: Great Location not too hot rooms My Wife and I wanted to stay some what close to the city and next to the beach. Bondi always being busy we choose Coogee beach. The hotel is literally right on the water. It is also next to some nice cafes, clubs, and pubs. So there is a lot to do within a short radius. Parking is free, which is unheard of in Sydney. The front desk are truly helpful and nice. We stayed in the Oceanview with the balcony. The room was a decent size and the views of the beach were quite nice. The balcony proved to be a nice place to have a few drinks before heading out for dinner. The furniture and carpets are a bit old, but are liveable. One thing I didnt understand was the elevator system. You would get off the elevator and then there would be a few stairs you would have to climb to get to your rooms door. Not too hard to do but if you have a lot of luggage it can get annoying. Overall a good stay for a good price.
Reviews.Author: TravelingSoldier

Reviews.Content: Comfy, friendly, excellent location Staff were top notch, hotel was very clean and well located. We had a courtyard studio with outdoor chairs and table, no views but very quiet and clean, bed v comfy. Parking was included - undercover, right next to reception, EASY! Convenience store a few doors down, beach 100 paces away. Good value too. The most friendly staff in all of Sydney, I'd have to say. We'd stay again!
Reviews.Author: hotelbrat

Reviews.Content: great hotel Hi we stayed here for a week, after staying in sydney, we loved the place. The rooms were large with seperate sitting area. a bottle of champagne was in are room on arrrival at no cost!!! the bed was huge and had a lovery furry blanket - we loved it. the hotel is right on the beach and next to some good restanrant and bars. the mini bar was stocked daily and were good prices. on are last day we had breakfast in bed just perfect. would recommend this hotel. Great that it has a little kitchen in room . Also on the roof is a great bbq and chairs don't think any one knows about it. we had a perfect meal for two up there.loved the place
Reviews.Author: luckyloupink

Reviews.Content: No problems -great time Have just come back from staying at the Coogee Sands Hotel and Apartments and have to disagree with the previous postie. As a family of 4 with 2 children we had great time, the rooms were very clean and tidy and the staff were very helpful. The price was very reasonable for Sydney standards. Being there over New Year we certainly had no problems with noise. We had a deluxe suite ( a bit on the small size for a family of 4) with a court yard which I would strongly recommend, also included a double bed and a double pull out sofa for the children. The room also included a mircowave, fridge and sink which was ideal for preparing small meals. Two levels of underground car parking available . The location of the place is fantastic being right on the beach. Lots of diffrent resturants to choose from in Coogee Bay Road - would recommend the Chinese resturant. Public transport great, will take you just about anywhere in Sydney. Would prefer to stay here then Bondi any day.
Reviews.Author: whatthe111111

Reviews.Content: Nice views, very very noisy Paid for upgrade for sea view, hotel right next to a night club and the worst holiday experience ever, was eventually moved to dingy back room... avoid at all costs
Reviews.Author: traveltortoise

Reviews.Content: Great spot by the beach I stayed at the Coogee Sands while on a recent training trip to Sydney. As a former resident of Sydney, the thing that struck me after my stay here was Why, when living in this city, did I not spent time in Coogee?. The hotel is average if you are in one of the standard rooms, however, if you stay here, make sure you are in an ocean view studio. It is these rooms that take this hotel from average to fantastic. Awaking to the sound of the surf, pulling open the blinds to be greeted by what has to be one of the best views in Sydney. Sure for those from abroad - it will not be the same as a bridge / Opera House view, or the hustle of Bondi - but for a domestic traveller who is more than a little over aussie kitch, this is a great location. Just ou of the CBD, but feels like a small town form up the coast somewhere.....So all in all - room, standard - view, fantastic!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Overpriced We (a group of 4) arrived in Coogee without a place to stay and headed to Coogee Sands Hotel on the recommendation of the New South Wales Tourist Board. It seemed to us that most of the hotel's efforts have been spent on creating a nice foyer as when you get up to the rooms they are very basic.Our biggest issue with the Coogee Sands is the price - we paid $189 for an average room, with a broken shower (that flooded most of the room) in a noisy hotel. I wouldn't say that this represented value for money at all and left feeling cheated (and $189 worse off).Nice foyer though.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
